questions.text: A number is first increased by 20% and then reduced by 15%. If the final value is 2040, then what is the initial value of the number?
questions.explain: Let the number be x. After 20% increase → 1.2x. After 15% decrease → 1.2x × 0.85 = 1.02x. So 1.02x = 2040 → x = 2000.

questions.text: Due to 20% reduction in the price of wheat per kg, Ram is able to buy 5 kg more for Rs. 800. What is the original quantity (in kg) of wheat?
questions.explain: Let price = p. Original quantity = 800/p. New price = 0.8p → New quantity = 800/(0.8p) = 1000/p. Difference = 1000/p - 800/p = 200/p = 5 → p = 40. Original quantity = 800/40 = 20 kg.

questions.text: Ramesh invested 30% more than Suresh. Suresh invested 40% less than Arun, who invested ₹8000. The total amount invested by all of them together is?
Two numbers are respectively, 17% and 50% more than a third number. The ratio of the two numbers is:
questions.explain: Let the third number be 100. First = 117, second = 150. Ratio = 117 : 150 = 39 : 50.

questions.text: A, B and C are positive numbers such that A is 70% of B, and B is 40% of C. If the sum of all three numbers is 336, then 15% of the sum of B and C is:
In an examination, 92% of the students passed and 480 students failed. How many students appeared in the examination?
questions.explain: Let total = x. Failed = 8% of x = 480 → x = 480×100/8 = 6000.

questions.text: When a number is increased by 24, it becomes 115% of itself. What is the number?
questions.explain: Let number = x. Equation: x + 24 = 1.15x → 0.15x = 24 → x = 160. (Check: 160+24=184, 115% of 160=184, correct.)
